Q: What has been your favorite thing… #AskMalala
- @hannahorenstein

1073395720491859969.text: I’m so glad she enjoyed the talk in Sydney! My advice is to never underestimate the potential that you carry. Don’t miss out on what you can achieve by doubting yourself. #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/Thehungrymum/status/1073342895028035585 …

1073394379472232454.text:

1073391429899177984.text: I use different techniques, like explaining the topics to my dad, essay planning and group discussion. It’s always good to find what works best for you. #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/EMCK97/status/1073388498114281472 …

1049590229529706498.text: We want girls to take part in creating the technology that will change our world — and who runs it. Read @MalalaFund’s new report, foreword by Apple CEO @tim_cook: http://malala.org/fullforce pic.twitter.com/ybc49mreWu

1048158084298932224.text: Congratulations to @NadiaMuradBasee and @DenisMukwege! Their work saves lives and helps women speak out about sexual violence. #NobelPeacePrizehttps://twitter.com/NobelPrize/status/1048135860607221760 …

1044294049669230592.text: We will not accept a world where decisions about our future are made in rooms we cannot enter. Congratulations to all the young leaders participating in #Youth2030 today.pic.twitter.com/WNwWtcvMou

1039546104902287366.text: Deeply saddened to hear about the demise of the former First Lady of Pakistan Begum Kalsoom Nawaz. Heartfelt condolences to all her family and prayers for the departed soul. Her political struggle and courage will be remembered.

1038225839924682753.text: So happy to be back in Canada today!  Thank you, Prime Minister, for your time and your commitment to education for every child.https://twitter.com/JustinTrudeau/status/1038155017692344320 …

1025388223810494466.text:
The extremists have shown what frightens them most - a girl with a book. 

We must rebuild these schools immediately, get the students back into their classrooms and show the world that every girl and boy has the right to learn.https://www.dawn.com/news/1424685

1021747441849323521.text: The people of Pakistan - especially women - the power is in your hands. Get up, go and vote! Democracy shall win! #Election2018 pic.twitter.com/LqVRUK9cjO

1020019650602635264.text: So much fun talking with journalist @ElaineWelteroth! Go to Assembly now to watch the full interview and hear Elaine's advice on finding your voice. https://mala.la/2JCaf8s pic.twitter.com/KsyZVVFIGt

1019603668788793346.text: "It is through education that the daughter of a peasant can become a doctor...that a child of farm workers can become the president of a great nation." - Nelson Mandela #Mandela100pic.twitter.com/Dj62BPEkkv

1018903742719184897.text: Last week in #Brazil, I started an Instagram account! Follow to see my photos: https://www.instagram.com/malala/ pic.twitter.com/rel0BYOUEU

1018461348278292480.text: Congratulations @serenawilliams on a terrific showing at #Wimbledon!

1017545959813902337.text: I have one wish on my birthday: to show these girls that they don't have to fight alone. You can help girls in Brazil and around the world by making a gift to @MalalaFund:http://mala.la/malala21bday

1017540270135611392.text: I am so grateful I could share this amazing experience with my friends @ElaineWelteroth, @ElJuanpaZurita and @jeromejarre. Each of us was inspired by the girls we met and the stories we heard.pic.twitter.com/Xa5scj1GNu

1017539045596057600.text: Malala Fund is investing around $700,000 in education activists in Brazil. We want to help them ensure that every girl in this country gets 12 years of free, safe, quality education.

1017538791739883520.text: In my time here, I’ve met many girls facing racism, poverty and violence. Because of these issues 1.5 million Brazilian girls - mostly indigenous and Afro-Brazilian girls - are not in school and they don’t feel safe.

1017538142524661760.text: We had a lot of fun playing football with girls on the beach. I didn’t know my dad @ZiauddinY was such a good goal keeper!pic.twitter.com/Q3YszmpLSC

1017535654324994050.text: Izabella and Bak are teenagers who create street art to fight back against the sexism and racism they experience. Their organization is called @RedeNami.pic.twitter.com/ATG37mvjYt

1017532532114558977.text: Paloma and her friends live in one of Rio's most dangerous neighborhoods. They find joy in a ballet class where the only cost is a good report card from school. Paloma's favourite subject is math.pic.twitter.com/wnwh9uXVAO

1017530710087950336.text: Maikele, Hiorrana and Itocovoti live in Bahia. As indigenous girls, they face discrimination in school and in society. But they are strong and determined to build a better future for their community.pic.twitter.com/VaGSyW9nJR

1017528785376333824.text: I turned 21 today in #Brazil. So happy to spend my birthday in this beautiful country with amazing girls. Want to meet some of my new friends?pic.twitter.com/OFRRyQ9kCR

1017258769808490498.text: Saddened by the #PeshawarBlast and the deaths of Haroon Bilour and 19 others in this tragedy - precious lives are lost in the struggle for democracy. Free, fair & peaceful elections in Pakistan are the only way to honor the sacrifices of the Bilour family.

1017148283251195911.text: Hoje eu estive com as mulheres da @RedeNami e juntas nós fizemos um retrato da Marielle Franco. Como ativista, sei que ela inspirou muitas mulheres e garotas brasileiras e sei que elas levarão seu legado adiante.

1017162898496544769.text: Eu amei Salvador! Nós passamos ótimos momentos andando pelas ruas, conhecendo pessoas, aprendendo sobre suas histórias e ouvindo músicas incríveis. #AskMalala #PergunteAMalalahttps://twitter.com/ivetesangalo/status/1017113112833642504 …

1017161609809154048.text: Hi, Pele! In Brazil today I met amazing girl footballers on the beach in Rio. They tell me that sport helps them deal with difficulties in their lives and gives them confidence. We should support women athletes so girls have more role models.  #AskMalala #PergunteAMalalahttps://twitter.com/Pele/status/1017100739104137216 …

1017149212319010817.text: Paulo, your words have inspired me for many years. I am so often asked my favorite book and I always say The Alchemist. I’m so honored to be in your beautiful country!  #AskMalala #PergunteAMalalahttps://twitter.com/paulocoelho/status/1017110568619200512 …

1017148674101645318.text: Eu sempre digo às garotas para não pensarem que elas precisam ser adultas para serem líderes. As garotas deveriam dizer às suas lideranças aquilo que precisam para alcançar seus objetivos e continuar usando suas vozes até serem ouvidas. Nunca desista. #AskMalala #PergunteAMalala https://twitter.com/carol_roq/status/1017104344494329856 …

1017148154066669568.text: Here and ready to answer your questions, Brazil! #AskMalala #PergunteAMalalahttps://twitter.com/MalalaFund/status/1017098716761772035 …

1017002205545680897.text: Proud to announce we're investing in girls' education in Brazil. More than 1.5 million girls are out of school in this country - and they deserve the chance to choose their own future.https://twitter.com/malalafund/status/1016903588084441088 …

1007441260351819776.text: Eid Mubarak and best wishes to my sisters and brothers celebrating around the world. #EidAlFitr

1005505078927810560.text: A significant step forward for girls. My statement on the #G7 Summit:pic.twitter.com/5nnmZJI1sb

995639261721440257.text: My strength, my heart, my soul. Happy #MothersDaypic.twitter.com/WVsliEXTyy

990363360263852037.text:
A moment of pride passing by Benazir Bhutto’s photos in my college @lmhoxford. 

First female Prime Minister in the Muslim world and Pakistan.pic.twitter.com/5vPwB6RNv3

987821079128363009.text: Grateful to Emily Blunt and @johnkrasinski for their friendship and their work for girls around the world. I was so moved by Emily’s powerful, empathetic speech on why she supports girls’ education.https://youtu.be/RPhrq8mva50

987394149254074368.text: These steps should be supported by new funding. As my fellow education advocate @PeaceAyo2 said in her #CHOGM18 speech: "Girls have fantastic dreams for our futures, but we can only achieve them if leaders invest in 12 years of free, safe, quality education."

987393898757677058.text: Last month I challenged Commonwealth leaders to commit to girls' education. I'm happy today's #CHOGM18 communiqué affirms the importance of 12 years of education for all girls and that the UK signed the Safe Schools Declaration to protect students from violence.

986263960335867905.text: Encouraged by UK’s commitment to put 12 years of free, safe, quality education for girls at the heart of the #CHOGM18 agenda today. I hope all #Commonwealth leaders will back this ambition with funding commitments.

986188852749578244.text: Proud of students especially girls from my hometown Swat showing their talent in science. Well done! @udhyaana #SwatScienceFestivalpic.twitter.com/eU0Mp2KLdG

984851295113830401.text: Thanks for all the great questions, talk to you soon #AskMalala

984850798768205824.text: Using tech to address equality, climate change, poverty, and access to education. #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/CodingLikeGirl/status/984839006314811392 …

984850127465705472.text: Watching @bigbangtheory right now. I'm still on season one, no spoilers. #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/Jaweriyaa/status/984849171483103239 …

984845169781592064.text: Shahid Afridi obviously and I am a big fan of cricket and proud of my Pakistani cricket team #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/taimoorze/status/984844505068331016 …

984844481181646849.text: I enjoy my philosophy classes. Favourite moment, it's all so exciting. Oxford is so beautiful. #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/Viet_VoPham/status/984831077876486144 …

984842570579824641.text: Continue raising your voices and don't stop. #AskMalalahttps://twitter.com/care_gift_elves/status/984839680905576448 …

977144637927362560.text: On this day, I cherish fond memories of home, of playing cricket on rooftops and singing the national anthem in school. Happy Pakistan Day!

971757551649001472.text: Thanks to the amazing women artists on my playlist (and many others) for inspiring us every day - and to all of you who suggested songs. Enjoy! #IWD2018https://twitter.com/starbucksmusic/status/971562870835048448 …

971703424914993152.text: Happy #IWD2018 to the girls and women leading movements for education and equality around the world! We stand with you.https://blog.malala.org/stand-up-first-a353c38d11d8 …

969588384548163585.text: I am making a playlist for International Women’s Day. Any song requests?  #IWD2018

964499772450230272.text: Female athletes receive only 4% of all sports media coverage. @MalalaFund wants you to meet the next generation of leaders - on and off the field. https://blog.malala.org/game-changers/home … #GameChangers #WinterOlympics2018pic.twitter.com/oR99mOwIn2

962644186364301312.text:
Heartbroken that we lost Asma Jahangir - a saviour of democracy and human rights. 

I met her a week ago in Oxford. I cannot believe she is no more among us. The best tribute to her is to continue her fight for human rights and democracy.pic.twitter.com/Tf7VOYfvq5

960945440488386560.text:
I express my solidarity with the ongoing peaceful #IslamabadSitin and appeal the Prime Minister, the Chief of Army Staff and the Chief Justice of Pakistan to take immediate notice of the genuine demands of the people of FATA and Pukhtoonkhwa.
#PukhtoonLongMarch
#JusticeForNaqib

960108817341206528.text: Thank you @Macky_Sall and @EmmanuelMacron for your leadership for @GPforEducation. This is only the beginning - we will keep working until every girl can go to school and choose her own future.https://twitter.com/malalafund/status/959565855762862086 …

958111425699962880.text: I was honored to welcome Muhammad Iqbal Lala to speak at Oxford Uni. His son, Mashal Khan, was brutally killed by a mob in Mardan Pakistan, based on malicious allegations of blasphemy. Mashal advocated against injustice & corruption. We stand with Lala to seek justice for Mashal.pic.twitter.com/HkByCex3Uh

955552206111035394.text: Dear @stephenfry, thank you for your kind words! No one is perfect but I'd be happy to give you a tour of Oxford so you can see what you've missedhttps://twitter.com/stephenfry/status/955428525632376833 …

955450833604431872.text: I am grateful to my friend Tim and @Apple for investing in our dream of a world where every girl can choose her own future. Together we will support the incredible girls we met in Beirut and millions like them around the world.https://twitter.com/tim_cook/status/955439870922645505 …

952893893212852224.text: Last September I was humbled to speak at Dr. Martin Luther King Jr.’s church. I shared what his work means to me and how we must continue his fight for justice. #MLKDay http://mala.la/2EEidMt

951082012068188162.text: Heartbroken to hear about Zainab - a 7 year old child abused and brutally killed in Kasur, Pakistan. This has to stop. Gov and the concerned authorities must take action. #JusticeForZainab

947534186742734848.text: P.S. Also both happy and nervous when @Lord_Sugar followed me last week!

947495563053985792.text: 2018: Keep working for a world where girls can choose their own future.

947494065746178048.text: The most memorable part of my year was meeting courageous girls who are fighting poverty, child marriage, conflict and war to continue their education.pic.twitter.com/erl5H10kdV

945994524375035904.text:
#ShaheedMohtarmaBenazirBhutto

You defined bravery to women and men. You did not just break glass ceilings but iron bars. 

You shielded democracy with your blood.

Whoever killed you must know that you will live in our hearts, forever.pic.twitter.com/cabIcTOqAN

945665345464995840.text:
The people of FATA, in the north-west of Pakistan, have been deprived of their human and constitutional rights for decades. 

I stand with @FataYouthJirga and demand the government to pass FATA reforms ASAP and merge FATA into Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province.pic.twitter.com/bqOSwyhyPV

941833014421594112.text:
Three years ago, 132 students were brutally killed at the Army Public School Peshawar. I think of them today and everyday. 

No child should face extremism and violence. No child should go to school in fear.

Every child deserves safe education.

939860743893192705.text:
The words Anne Frank wrote in this room still remind us to cherish and defend human rights. 

Today, I am thinking of Palestinian and Rohingya children- and all around the world still struggling to achieve Anne’s dream of freedom.

#HumanRightsDaypic.twitter.com/jmFcYTkZoR

937755033176768517.text: Thank you so much to all Malala Fund board members  so grateful to have you all  had a wonderful time in Netherlands pic.twitter.com/2VL7Wga9uV

936612114134917122.text:
When you pick up a gun in the name of Islam and kill innocent people, you are not a Muslim anymore. 

Strongly condemn the brutal attack in Peshawar killing innocent people on #EidMiladunNabi (PBUH) - a holy day for Muslims.https://www.dawn.com/news/1374048/3-dead-as-peshawar-agricultural-university-attacked-4-terrorists-killed …

936183424515235840.text:
Honoured to meet at Oxford with dear Mansoor Ali Shah - Chief Justice of Lahore High Court Pakistan.

Thank you for taking brave steps and doing incredible work to bring justice for everyone.pic.twitter.com/vCnYth3Tv4

935677843094278149.text: There's still time to do some good today and help girls around the world.  Thank you so much to everyone who has given already. Your support means so much to me. #GivingTuesdayhttps://twitter.com/MalalaFund/status/935674683189444608 …

935637284678000640.text: @BecauseImFreida! Thanks for calling our amazing supporters! #GivingTuesday http://mala.la/2mPUW6f https://twitter.com/MalalaFund/status/935619135068950530 …

935550205650505728.text: I’m calling donors on Facebook Live right now! Watch: https://www.facebook.com/MalalaFund/videos/2092933920720449/ … #GivingTuesdaypic.twitter.com/0I4W8Fikat

935520805705928709.text: Could not have said it better myself! Thank you, @melissamccarthy #GivingTuesday http://mala.la/2mPUW6f pic.twitter.com/hkp4FtqHUJ

935141774925975552.text: Tomorrow I am making phone calls to people who support girls' education and equality. Do I have your number? http://mala.la/2zJKj9M

932612718825299969.text:
To every child - I dream of a world where you can laugh, dance, sing, learn, live in peace and be happy.

#WorldChildrensDay

930161526174027783.text: Thank you to my friends @rizmc, @azizansari, @mindykaling and @BecauseImFreida for speaking out for Rohingya people. I join you.https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/nov/10/rohingya-genocide-ethnic-cleansing-never-again …

929723038576316418.text: My beautiful mother - my friend, my role model, my strength, my heart, my soulpic.twitter.com/ARLLglyFta

928746588691943424.text: Strongly recommend this book that tells tragic, heartbreaking unbelievable stories of stolen girls in Nigeria.pic.twitter.com/UDuanZPOtZ

920252814533808128.text: I hope this book inspires children to believe in themselves and follow their dreams. Available today: http://bit.ly/2y6Ds7r pic.twitter.com/JZMlFuHpoy

916643858351616000.text:
Older sister’s advice:

914142544023433216.text: Packing for university  Any tips? Advice? Dos and dont's? #HelpMalalaPack

912805268072824832.text: In the House, @RepHalRogers & @NitaLowey said they would be as helpful as they can be. I told them millions of girls are counting on them!pic.twitter.com/p5lGB6wm8R

912803468909391872.text: Senator @JeanneShaheen and I agree that we must focus more on adolescent girls. They are the key to a safer, healthier, wealthier world.pic.twitter.com/EhikOxnzhj

912802840770486273.text: Senator @marcorubio left D.C. to help Puerto Rico - but I stopped by to ask his staff to thank him for his support for school for all girls.pic.twitter.com/fZIFRhzpQ9

912802420505370624.text: First stop: I asked @PatrickLeahy to work w colleagues to keep $800mn in the budget for ed. He said girls' education is a bipartisan issue.pic.twitter.com/cyOXnVKrNr

912801806752894977.text: Yesterday I visited Capitol Hill in Washington to talk to members of Congress about girls' education. [THREAD]

910974126059343872.text: Pray for peace for every person. #PeaceDaypic.twitter.com/KYiFEuHEug

910695124547571712.text: I asked Vice President @gabimichetti to focus on education when Argentina hosts the #G20 summit next year. Better  starts w/ girls. #UNGA17pic.twitter.com/f4bAvy89Lh

910691630914707467.text: President @ashrafghani and I talked about the need for more women teachers in Afghanistan. #UNGA17pic.twitter.com/lzbdd4aGCs

910651935451164677.text: Honoured to meet PM Shahid Khaqan Abbasi. We are in agreement that the future of Pakistan relies on education. #UNGA17pic.twitter.com/rtd5iN5pR6

910633210073243648.text: Spoke with Prime Minister @markrutte of the Netherlands about his country's commitment to education in conflict. #UNGA17pic.twitter.com/gBQ0NTf6G6

910618535570833408.text: Thank you @nikolajcw for your work and for hosting an honest conversation about violence against women and girls. #UNGA17pic.twitter.com/YH0M4SE8qO

910577699399372800.text: Congratulating Prime Minister @erna_solberg on her re-election and asking #Norway to continue supporting girls' education. #UNGA17pic.twitter.com/RyNwiF9pUk

910559017424031745.text: President @EmmanuelMacron, Madame Macron and I had a great discussion about girls' education & how #France can help. We need his leadership!pic.twitter.com/nujploaA9n

910495580509671424.text: Honored to meet fellow Nobel Laureate and incredible peace activist @LeymahRGbowee backstage at #Goalkeepers17.pic.twitter.com/LxWyLcnm4s

910479938318413824.text: In #NYC for a big day on girls' education. Follow along with me & @MalalaFund to see which leaders deliver for our sisters. #UNGA2017

910270627982036992.text: Estoy rezando por México / sending my prayers to México.

908396102399008768.text: Eating pakoras with my bestie @ellenhahn_ before we separate for uni. pic.twitter.com/DRmaGTcxSq

906135727452426240.text: Concerned for my friends in Mexico after the earthquake and all in the path of Hurricane Irma. My family and I pray for you.

Let’s go forward together 
for justice, 
with hope, 
in peace. 
- Malalahttps://youtu.be/okGlFU3YW_k

905084194270973952.text: On Sunday, I was honored to speak at @ebenezer_atl, Dr. Martin Luther King's church. @RaphaelWarnock and his congregation inspire me.pic.twitter.com/WkQ0gZlaBo

905083931476856832.text: Not goodbye but hasta la próxima, México! @MalalaFund and I want to work for girls in your country. We are already making plans to return.pic.twitter.com/7nv1PqoWo9

905083293217021952.text: They've faced early marriage, discrimination and displacement but they're determined to be leaders in their communities.pic.twitter.com/Fw289PmzEv

905082859404263424.text: We made lunch together and talked about the fight for education in their communities.pic.twitter.com/1om383ZoT9

905082649374580736.text:
As I end another amazing journey, some thoughts and thanks: 
In México, I met girls from Oaxaca, Colombia and Brazil. #GirlPowerTrippic.twitter.com/Uyzvwkfqm6

903767889580195840.text: Thanks to Hugo from Twitter Mexico for translating my answers and to everyone who sent a question. That was fun! #PreguntaAMalala #AskMalalapic.twitter.com/Py3PnCJV9G

903755546716712961.text: #askMalala #preguntaAMalala aún estoy trabajando en firmar un acuerdo de paz con ellos https://twitter.com/hector_coba/status/903753987551309825 …

903754924491755523.text: #preguntaAMalala me gusta el español y quisiera aprenderlo. Me gustan los idiomas (ya hablo tres)https://twitter.com/DeusArcanam/status/903751132194988033 …

903754359233765376.text: #preguntaAMalala me emociona empezar mi primer año en la universidad y vivir lejos de casa por primera vez.https://twitter.com/AlinneMedellin/status/903752479388557312 …

903753665093279744.text: #preguntaAMalala sin duda pero debemos seguir trabajando para que sea así.https://twitter.com/irenegrimes3112/status/903751463402430464 …

903753348381323264.text: #preguntaAMalala Debes ser la primera en tener confianza en ti misma. Si fallas no dejes de seguir intentándolo.https://twitter.com/estefan999/status/903752355467931650 …

903751123282128896.text: Sopa, tamales, and some delicious fish #askMalalahttps://twitter.com/zwiitt/status/903671957815607296 …

903750409868759044.text: Leer y pasar el tiempo con mis amigos (no tengo mucho tiempo libre )https://twitter.com/DanyFlames/status/903737121348964353 …

903669411185397760.text: Dear Mexico: Want to have a Twitter chat at 5:30pm CST today? Send your questions to #AskMalala.

903666761702170624.text: Querido Mexico: ¿Quiere hablar conmigo hoy por Twitter a las 5:30pm CST? Manda tus preguntas a #PreguntaAMalala.pic.twitter.com/NmQmV4C5xq

903628764562821120.text: Wishing Muslim brothers and sisters around the world Eid Mubarak from Mexico.

903607706594017280.text: Today I am meeting girls from Oaxaca, Colombia & Brazil. They fought poverty, child marriage, displacement & discrimination to go to school.pic.twitter.com/Qn5fuCrwro

903387863235960832.text: Muchísimas gracias to all the wonderful students at @TecdeMty for the warm welcome to México! You inspire me. #MalalaenelTecpic.twitter.com/t8WyWX0fEs

903275011074433025.text: Despite the delays, I got to wake up to a beautiful view this morning. Thank you, Cancun and looking forward to arriving in México City.pic.twitter.com/G35KDOwAeo

903274624095444992.text: Hola, México! Yesterday my flight was diverted from CDMX to Cancun because of the storm. At airport now - see you at @TecdeMonterrey soon!pic.twitter.com/2KLAd4DFBT

901138202181984256.text: Thank you, Millie - for the kind words but even more for your support for girls' education. #heroine https://twitter.com/milliebbrown/status/899623616307802113 …

898888867264303105.text: Salute to Dr. Ruth Pfau, credited with eradicating leprosy in Pakistan. She left a legacy.http://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-40986492 …

898083175213260800.text: So excited to go to Oxford!! Well done to all A-level students - the hardest year. Best wishes for life ahead!pic.twitter.com/miIwK6fNSf

897296391692836865.text: Happy Independence Day India! Fully agree with @SAfridiOfficial that we should join hands for education and peace.https://twitter.com/safridiofficial/status/897155638580707328 …

896838975771602945.text: .@MalalaFund will continue to send girls to school in my country and work towards a better and more equal Pakistan. #PakistanZindabad

896838663283322881.text: As we remember the struggles of our founding leaders, we must unite for democracy and the education of Pakistani children.

896838313788788736.text: Happy 70th Independence Day to all my Pakistani sisters and brothers!

896069828691218432.text: I love getting letters from girls & hearing their stories. You can read some of my recent replies to girls (and one boy) around the world. https://twitter.com/MalalaFund/status/896066133614186497 …

893137755785404417.text: I hope Malala's Magic Pencil inspires children around the world with its beautiful illustrations by artists Kerascoët. Out in October!

893137480458715136.text: So happy that my mother, Toor Pekai, who is learning English, is the first one to read the book.pic.twitter.com/VzoQNDyJ3o

893136985153339394.text: Opened the mail and thrilled to find a copy of my first picture book, Malala's Magic Pencil!pic.twitter.com/Zwoa1f28cC

891732412073431043.text: Thank you, @muniba_mazari. You are a symbol of resilience and it was wonderful to talk with you.https://twitter.com/muniba_mazari/status/891625305173045248 …

889555621116354561.text: My statement on the terrible attacks in Lahore and Kabul today.pic.twitter.com/oyMpdbNWcP

889148851784962048.text: My little brother @atalkyousafzai, the cutest and cheekiest boy, with his new hair.pic.twitter.com/m3eXAdl32Q

888689487752069120.text: One more  from my trip: This is me and @FarahMohamed_5 working hard, while my father @ZiauddinY just tweets. pic.twitter.com/dAKWF0YZvl

888018102386122752.text: #GirlPowerTrip continues soon. Latin America, you’re next! , Malala 22/

888017560255516672.text: .@MalalaFund and I will keep monitoring Nigeria’s progress. Watch this space. 20/

888017416990724096.text: Third, I asked the federal government to encourage all states to pass the Child Rights Act, which prohibits marriage before age 18. 19/

888017272316547073.text: Second, I asked him to make spending transparent, so that activists like @HamzyCODE and @4lowthemoney can track the funds. 18/

888017126170259456.text: My plea included three points: First, triple the proportion of Nigeria’s budget spent on education. 17/

888017013611700227.text: I asked him to declare an education state of emergency in Nigeria — and immediately help girls fighting to go to school. 16/

888016799526211585.text: After listening and learning from girls, educators and advocates, I met with Acting President @ProfOsinbajo. (Amina came with me!) 15/pic.twitter.com/kNJOG8iUYA

888016516901425152.text: I met girls from North & South Nigeria, Muslim & Christian, Hausa & English-speaking. They all want their sisters to go to school. 14/pic.twitter.com/q3FtcqtWwt

888016188219031554.text: And with Gulmakai Champions Habiba Mohammed of @CGEPRHI and Rotimi Olawale of @youthhubafrica. http://malala.org/gulmakai  13/pic.twitter.com/bzzU2cFXdg

888015875156168705.text: I caught up with my friend and fellow girl advocate Amina. http://mala.la/2u4JgMB  12/pic.twitter.com/mcmdoJhJVx

888015670293745665.text: And I pray that the thousands more girls and women taken by extremists will be freed. My heart breaks for their suffering. 11/

888015397542404097.text: I met 106 Chibok girls freed from Boko Haram. They are receiving good care, but I hope they can be home with their families soon. 10/pic.twitter.com/nbYzTMB82L

888015200028413956.text: On my next #GirlPowerTrip stop, I traveled to Nigeria, the country with the most out-of-school girls in the world. 9/

888015042247053312.text: I also met with Dr. Omar, Iraq's Minister of Education. I asked for his help in matching @PMBarzani's commitment — and he was supportive. 8/pic.twitter.com/ggLoBfM12p

888014810314661889.text: PM Barzani promised me his government would increase education spending to help girls like Najla and Nayir. 7/pic.twitter.com/28oxDRsaLo

888014423729852417.text: I carried their stories with me when I met Kurdistan’s @PMBarzani. 6/pic.twitter.com/mDZFIJOMdv

888013853719744512.text: She missed three years of school. Today she studies under a tent in the sweltering heat. But she’s determined. http://mala.la/2tdY49y  5/

888013578187493376.text: I also met Nayir, a 13 year-old Iraqi girl whose family fled Mosul after ISIS captured her father. 4/pic.twitter.com/Bq1guGubMQ

888013335932923905.text: As a young teenager, Najla ran away from home in her wedding dress. She’s incredible: http://mala.la/2u1rBax  3/

888013207146835968.text: Girls like Najla in Kurdistan battle early marriage and extremists to go to school and choose their own futures — and hair color! 2/pic.twitter.com/q83GbyeqT9

888013042314883072.text: Over the last two weeks, I traveled to Kurdistan / Iraq and Nigeria to meet girls struggling to go to school. #GirlPowerTrip [THREAD]

887064892938887168.text: Please read this story of the incredible Yazidi girls I met last week.https://twitter.com/MalalaFund/status/886977561930158080 …

886941079546843136.text: Cheering on #TeamAfghanistan girls in the global robotics competition today. So proud of you! #GirlsInStem

885838265781190656.text: My brother's birthday card to me. Ok, I will follow you @Khushal_KY - but just for today. Make it count! pic.twitter.com/A2yk2mOGgq

885175144645357569.text: On my last night as a teenager, I bumped into my new friends in Iraq. pic.twitter.com/4RfSBhoyUE

885131113701748736.text: Spending my 20th birthday with girls in Kurdistan / Iraq. Read more http://mala.la/2tdY49y  & follow @MalalaFund for updates. #GirlPowerTrippic.twitter.com/G4hW3YFPab

884061874878386176.text: Hola, Presidente! I admire your work to bring peace in Colombia. Your country has some amazing girls too! They send me beautiful messages. https://twitter.com/JuanManSantos/status/883376446181433344 …

883758033670737924.text: Edhi, a selfless & devoted humanitarian, is my hero. I will give to #EdhiFoundation in Pakistan. Will you? http://edhi.org/ https://twitter.com/ZiauddinY/status/883729460465479680 …

883705899189235712.text: Thank you to everyone for the warm welcome. I'm still reading all your replies and it may take awhile. Glad I joined AFTER exams!

883326881193394176.text: On and off Twitter, I'm fighting for girls —  will you join me?​ 6/

883326292476743680.text: Each girl’s story is unique  —  and girls' voices are our most powerful weapons in the fight for education and equality. 5/

883326003321483264.text: Next week, I will be back on my #GirlPowerTrip to meet girls in Middle East, Africa & Latin America. 4/

883325846919970816.text: ....I know that millions of girls around the world are out of school and may never get the opportunity to complete their education. 3/

883325485966643200.text: Graduating from secondary school (high school) is bittersweet for me. I'm excited about my future, but... 2/

883325245012226048.text: Today is my last day of school and my first day on @Twitter [THREAD]
